variants.Description in input context: SNCA p.Ala697Thr (c.2091G>A) causes altered protein folding
SNCA p.Val431Met (c.1294A>T) demonstrates loss of proteasomal degradation

Material used.Material Name: Brain Tissue from MSA patients and controls
Material used.Description: Immunofluorescence was performed on post-mortem brain tissue from patients diagnosed with MSA, and age-matched controls.

Readout description.Result Description: SNCA p.Ala697Thr showed increased aggregation and altered cellular localization in MSA brains compared to controls.
SNCA p.Val431Met showed reduced levels of proteasomal degradation, suggesting accumulation of the mutant protein.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was repeated with brain tissue from five independent MSA patients and five age-matched controls.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was processed and imaged three times independently.

Basic positive control.Description: Commercially available antibodies for α-synuclein and ubiquitin were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: An isotype control antibody was used to assess non-specific binding.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed t-test was used to compare signal intensity between MSA patients and controls.
